titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Samuel Claggett Chew (1888-1960) was a professor of English Literature at Bryn Mawr College from 1914 to 1954. His particular area of expertise was 19th century English literature and he authored many books and thousands of articles and reviews on Thomas Hardy, Lord Byron, and a range of other subjects. He received his bachelor's and doctoral degrees from Johns Hopkins University. He married Lucy Evans Chew, a former student, in 1918.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Samuel Claggett Chew. Materials include: manuscripts, scrapbooks, reprints, professional correspondence, research notes and bibliographies, and photographs. The collection also contains some materials related to his wife, Lucy Evans Chew, including writings and class assignments. The collection also includes an extensive postcard collection of images of France, Italy and other European destinations, as well as Egypt.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: Lucy Evans Chew papers; Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Chew family papers
